title: Remote Photo for Android Wear
summary: Remote control your phone camera with your wearable and take pictures
description: Remote control your phone camera with your wearable and take pictures, selfies and group photosYou can take pictures by clicking on your wearable screenYou can also take pictures by simply shaking your wristWorks on android wearable watches (Moto360, Samsung Gear Live, LG G Watch etc..) untill you stay in the Bluetooth range perimeter of your phone, which should be Android 4.3+ to use the appTo start the app after install, use the "Ok Google" voice command "Ok Google, launch camera"*, or launch it from the "Start" menu (on the wearable, scrolldown on the "Ok Google" menu > Click "Start" > Scroll untill you reach the app "Camera")*Note that it works on your default language (English: "Ok Google, launch camera" - French: "Ok Google, lancer caméra" - etc...)****************************************************************************************************************************#Licenses and CreditsThis program'sources are free*: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License V3 as published by the Free Software Foundation. descriptionHTML:
Remote control your phone camera with your wearable and take pictures, selfies and group photos

You can take pictures by clicking on your wearable screen
You can also take pictures by simply shaking your wrist

Works on android wearable watches (Moto360, Samsung Gear Live, LG G Watch etc..) untill you stay in the Bluetooth range perimeter of your phone, which should be Android 4.3+ to use the app

To start the app after install, use the "Ok Google" voice command "Ok Google, launch camera"*, or launch it from the "Start" menu (on the wearable, scrolldown on the "Ok Google" menu > Click "Start" > Scroll untill you reach the app "Camera")
*Note that it works on your default language (English: "Ok Google, launch camera" - French: "Ok Google, lancer caméra" - etc...)

recentChanges: You still can take pictures by clicking on your wearable screen
And you also can now trigger photo shoot by just  shaking your wrist
